content.en: Materials Science Algorithms: Scientists have developed algorithms to answer various research questions in the field of materials science. For example, they have used the Tougaard method to analyze the nanostructure of thin metal films on silicon during annealing. Spectroellipsometry has been employed with the WKBJ method and Bruggeman effective medium theory to monitor the growth of microcrystalline silicon in real-time. Additionally, algorithms based on the transport approximation and Monte Carlo simulations have been used to study the effects of elastic-electron scattering and determine film thicknesses. These algorithms play a crucial role in advancing our understanding of materials and their properties.
content.da: Algoritmer inden for Materialevidenskab: Forskere har udviklet algoritmer til at besvare forskellige forskningsspørgsmål inden for materialevidenskab. For eksempel har de anvendt Tougaard-metoden til at analysere nanostrukturen af tynde metalfilm på silicium under annealing. Spektroellipsometri er blevet brugt sammen med WKBJ-metoden og Bruggeman's effektive medieteori til at overvåge væksten af mikrokrystallinsk silicium i realtid. Derudover er algoritmer baseret på transportapproximationen og Monte Carlo-simuleringer blevet brugt til at studere effekterne af elastisk-elektron spredning og bestemme filmtykkelse. Disse algoritmer spiller en afgørende rolle i at fremme vores forståelse af materialer og deres egenskaber.
